Key Match Events: The New York Yankees chased Cleveland Guardians ace Tanner Bibee in the second inning.
Aaron Judge hit his first home run of the postseason in the seventh inning.
The Yankees secured a 6-3 win to take a 2-0 lead in the ALCS.
Gerrit Cole ended his night after 4 1/3 innings, allowing two earned runs.
José Ramírez hit a solo home run in the ninth inning for the Guardians.
Pre-Game Insights: Gerrit Cole, a six-time All-Star and reigning AL Cy Young Award winner, started for the Yankees.
Tanner Bibee started on the mound for the Guardians.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt explained his decision to pull Tanner Bibee early, stating that although Bibee was throwing well, the Yankees were getting to him.
Vogt expressed hope that the Guardians could get some offense going.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians used eight pitchers during the game.
The series now shifts to Cleveland with the Guardians in desperate need of a Game 3 victory.
The Guardians dropped starting pitcher Alex Cobb from their postseason roster due to a back strain.
